alert.note: Alert for Piscataquis (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 22 at 3:33AM EST until December 22 at 4:34PM EST by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 4 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...River flooding caused by upstream dam release continues. * WHERE...A portion of North Central Maine, including the following county, Piscataquis. * WHEN...Until 400 PM EST Friday. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying areas near the river. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 329 AM EST, an upstream floodgate release at the Ripogenus Dam is expected to cause minor flooding in the Abol Bridge Campground and along the Appalachian Trail north of Abol Bridge. - Minor flooding is ongoing along the Appalachian Trail at the southern end of Baxter State Park as well as near the ATV kiosk at the Abol Bridge. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Baxter State Park and Abol Bridge. - Discharge at the Ripogenus Dam is approximately 9950 cfs. - For flood safety visit http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
